profile.headline: Co-founder Chameleon 🦎 Posts = UX, PLG, SaaS, startups
profile.summary:
THREE KEY THINGS ABOUT USER ONBOARDING YOU SHOULD KNOW:

1. It extends beyond sign-up! It encompasses every change in your product, and it is needed for old users and new features. Think of it across the user lifecycle not just at the beginning. 

2. Getting users to act is a combination of them knowing WHY as well as HOW to accomplish something. You have to reinforce your value and benefits before directing users to action.

3. Focus on the "aha moment": this is the goal for each small piece of user onboarding, and without knowing this, it'll be hard for you to predictably generate more success. 

My product, Chameleon, helps you build great user onboarding without requiring any code, so you're in control and can optimize your way towards user happiness and product engagement. 

Learn more and try it for free at chameleon.io

experiences.title: Co-founder & CEO
experiences.description:
One of the biggest recent trends in product UX is interactive in-product guidance. Communicating with customers is now more dynamic and contextual than ever before, and Chameleon helps you tap into this new channel without using up your engineering time. 

Learn more: chameleon.io

Backed by Matrix Partners, True Ventures, Maiden Lane, Auren Hoffman and others

experiences.title: Angel Investor
experiences.description: Advise and invest in early-stage rounds of product-led companies, especially those selling to product teams or technology companies. Take a proactive approach to helping, including Slack DM access, regular syncs, and product feedback. Feel free to reach out for input if you're an early stage founder that's beyond prototype but pre PM fit.

experiences.title: Featured Speaker
experiences.description: Speaker and expert on user onboarding and product-led growth topics at Product School- a leader in Product Management training with a community of over one million product professionals.

experiences.title: Mentor
experiences.description: The Refiners is a San Francisco-based accelerator devoted to helping foreign startups thrive in Silicon Valley. More info here: http://www.therefiners.co/

experiences.title: Sleuth
experiences.description:
shoto takes the pain away from collecting photos from friends on a group trip. The app automatically creates a group album when friends are taking photo together and all you have to do is take photos with your normal phone camera! Available in the App Store and Google Play and more info at shoto.com

My role includes:
- Operations: project management; bookkeeping / accounting; legal liaison; regulatory; office management; strategic planning etc. 
- Analytics: identification of key metrics, implementation of internal dashboards, regular reporting etc.
- Business Development: identification of user acquisition channels, planning and executing marketing activities, sourcing partners etc.

experiences.title: Senior Consultant
experiences.description:
Independently drove analysis and managed team members during engagements at two large financial services providers. 

Formulated and launched networking initiative amongst junior staff. Elected representative of Consultant and Senior Consultant cohort.

On sabbatical leave since end 2012

experiences.title: Consultant
experiences.description:
Conducted research (primary and desk), performed analysis (primarily based on Excel models) and presented findings to senior stakeholders in range of engagements across industries including oil & gas, utilities, non-profit, consumer goods, financial services and private equity. 

Responsible for managing team of six analysts during 10-month business transformation engagement with a leading Indian petrochemicals firm.

experiences.title: Co-founder
experiences.description:
Co-founded an enterprise to sell handicrafts made by underprivileged communities in India and Kenya to retail consumers. Achieved operational break-even after one year.

Coordinated team and managed all aspects of shop alongside working full-time; sourced products recommended by charity volunteers, conducted customer surveys to set pricing, held marketing events to increase footfall and learnt basic bookkeeping to manage accounts.

experiences.title: Fellow
experiences.description:
Selected to join grassroots development and personal transformation fellowship. 

Worked with rural social enterprise incubator to develop and teach business planning course to promote entrepreneurship amongst youth in challenging setting in rural India. Conducted extensive promotional marketing via multiple channels.

Took extra management responsibilities at host organization, including managing operations and driving the definition and adoption of a new culture. Supported by team of four staff and volunteers.

experiences.title: Summer Consultant
experiences.description: Successfully completed summer internship as top-ranked intern and offered graduate position.

education.activities_and_societies: National Hindu Students' Forum, Queens' College Football Team, Queens' College JCR, Mastana

accomplishment_projects.title: Settled
accomplishment_projects.description: Settled is a personal assistant for moving abroad that won first place among 10 teams and more than 125 participants at San Francisco's Startup Weekend Immigration. It streamlines the admin of settling in a new country — tasks such as getting an ID, a bank account, and a place to live — into a simple, personalized, and efficient process.

experiences.title: Operations Manager
experiences.description:
My duties and responsibilities at this construction instrumentation company included: 
• Prepared, wrote and reviewed proposals.
• Addressed clients requests for certificates of insurance, and other company documents for contracts.
• Recruited, assigned, scheduled, and monitored employees for efficiency.
• Determined equipment needs, inventory management and storage requirements.
• Developed, implemented, enforced and evaluated policies and procedures.
• Reviewed and approved operational invoices and ensured they were submitted for payment.
• Reviewed and approved all employees’ timesheets.
• Ran weekly office meetings where operating policies, issues, safety and weekly work were discussed.
• Attended outreach meetings and networking events.
• Managed relationships with new and existing clients.
• Devised ways of improving the clients experience, including resolving problems and complaints, researched new technology to further improve quality of work.

profile.headline: Senior Backend Engineer at Chameleon, the deepest product adoption platform
profile.summary:
• Seasoned developer with 10+ years of experience & deep expertise in Ruby on Rails
• Experienced in leading projects and mentoring teams to deliver full-stack solutions
• Passionate about easing tasks for everyone by improving processes and automating workflows

experiences.title: Senior Backend Engineer
experiences.description:
• Mentoring team members on Ruby & Rails best practices enabling Frontend Engineers to independently deliver full-stack features, significantly increasing project velocity
• Lead Native A/B Testing Feature Implementation: developing a key market differentiator, directly influencing customer decisions in favor of Chameleon
• Implement Two-Factor Authentication to enhance security features, meeting critical customer requirements and facilitating new business agreements

experiences.title: Senior Software Development Engineer
experiences.description:
• Led a team of 3 engineers to rapidly implement a self-service publishing solution on a legacy Ruby framework, enabling the content marketing team to publish efficiently during the new engine's development
• Steered design & implementation of a new NextJS-based self-service publishing engine, streamlining & simplifying content management for the marketing team
• Engaged with stakeholders to identify specific requirements and establish development priorities, resulting in a streamlined project timeline and enhanced collaboration

experiences.title: Senior Software Developer
experiences.description:
• Implemented some of the most used 3rd-party integrations for the platform
• Built an advanced Query Builder for an internal email marketing tool that allowed for building custom audiences of users and leads via UI instead of having to involve a developer to query it via SQL. This enabled marketing team to send more targeted emails with minimal friction
• Lead Postgres migration from legacy 9.3 to 11 on a cluster of 4 database servers
• Migrated CI from an old Jenkins server to a modern Buildkite based setup to speed up builds and reduce waiting time, with automated provisioning through Ansible that allowed to bring up new CI servers with ease

experiences.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer
experiences.description:
• Working on electronic reporting SaaS solution for Fishing industry
• Implemented fully customizable form solution that allow set up data collection for non-standard things such as marine biology sampling
• Developed a custom translation backend for Rails I18n module that allowed for seamless addition of organization-specific translations to make adoption easier as lingo varies a lot across the industry
• Lead an initiative to improve code quality and style consistency with CodeClimate and Rubocop

experiences.title: Independent Web Developer
experiences.description:
Developed a variety of web applications including CRM and SaaS products from scratch
• Worked with customers to gather requirements and establish efficient development process
• Repairsurge.com - a SaaS that provides car mechanics with OEM repair manuals, redesigned a legacy MVP app to build a modern robust solution (Ruby on Rails, 2016-2017)
• Serverscope.io - side-project, benchmarking for servers (Ruby on Rails, Python, 2016)
• Custom CRM app for a distributed mortgage broker in US (PHP), streamlining their process
• A lot of experience diving into new codebases to fix bugs or performance issues

experiences.title: Techincal Lead
experiences.description:
Technical Lead (Mar 2016  – Aug 2016)
Web Programmer (Feb 2014 – Mar 2016)

•	Rebuilt core modules of an internal ERP application to improve reliability which eliminated required weekly maintenance of legacy systems (gathering requirements, shadowing users, programming, training & maintenance)
•	Automated tons of weekly / monthly reports that used to take up to 8 hours each to build
•	Lead the switch from SVN linear workflow to feature branching approach using Git: got everybody on board, executed technical side and facilitated the training.
•	Refactored multiple legacy SQL queries to improve maintainability, reduced complexity and length from 1000+ lines to just 20-30 lines of code
•	Lead decisions on technology updates, app architecture, and development process improvements

experiences.company: Seneca College of Applied Arts and Technology

Programmer / Analyst Co-Op
experiences.description:

•	Refactored and improved automated report generation tools, reduced size of the source code from over 900 lines to just over 100 (VBA, MS Access)
•	Analyzed business procedures to determine necessary functional information to be provided in snapshot reports for production line use as well as upper management use
•	Involved in development / modification of reports in corporate work order management system during my Co-Op term (Crystal Reports)
•	Provided technical expertise to department staff (MS Access, Excel, VBA)

experiences.title: Project Development Manager

Podster.ru is a sophisticated system of distributing and monetizing audio-content on the Internet.

•	Dramatically improved performance of some parts of the application (up to 900%)

profile.headline: Front End Specialist at Chameleon, the deepest product adoption platform
profile.summary:
Hey! 👋 I'm Felipe, a Frontend Specialist with 10+ years in Sofware Development.
 
I enjoy to travel, learn, teach, design user interfaces and code web/mobile apps. I also play guitar and drums, and I suck at both.
 
What drives my work is to build a better web for people — by sharing knowledge through talks, organizing tech communities, and specially, by building meaningful things that positively impact lives.

🦎 Currently, I'm part of Chameleon team -- the deepest product adoption platform.

experiences.title: Sr Frontend Engineer
experiences.description:
Chameleon is the best-in-class product adoption platform. It offers solutions for better user onboarding, feature discovery, user feedback & analytics -- all of that in a unique tool that can be seamlessly integrated into web apps.

Chameleon Website: https://www.chameleon.io/
Open Positions: https://www.chameleon.io/jobs

experiences.title: Sr Frontend Engineer
experiences.description:
Toptal is an exclusive network of expert freelancers.

Besides freelancing, I was also part of their Speakers Network and Community Leaders Network.

experiences.title: Sr Frontend Engineer
experiences.description:
BabyCenter is the best content & community website on pregnancy, parenthood & childhood.

There, I was responsible for both maintaining and evolving ~15+ years-old legacy codebases, and remaking them using modern technologies (PWAs, React/Hooks, GraphQL/Apollo, NextJS, Jest, Cypress) as well as implementing/maintaining third-party integrations (GA, GTM, AWS, Snowplow).

My activities there included:
- Implementing features based on modern JavaScript APIs (Service Workers, PWAs, etc.)
- Integrating third-party libraries
- Ads customization/configuration & header-bidding
- Pixel-perfect UI implementations
- Front end performance management & enhancement

experiences.title: Sr Frontend Developer
experiences.description:
At Translucent, I worked in one of my favorite projects: an app for helping children and teenage cancer patients (and their doctors) improve their treatment by tracking their symptoms and providing oriented insights.

Projects

Spark (Web/JavaScript):
- What was it: Web app to help doctors treat kids/teenagers cancer patients
- Refactored legacy codebase
- Modularized a single file (~15k lines, using jQuery and old standards) into a proper organized web app (using latest JavaScript specs)
- Solved previously-existing bugs
- Evolved the app with new features
- Added Print CSS for client-side print rendering of specific chart pages

CBB Connect (iOS/Swift):
- What was it: App for calculating car pricing & rating
- Designed the entire app using Sketch
- Implemented UI/Frontend in Swift (Visual Format Language)
- Used Google Material, Alamofire, and RxSwift libs
- App Store link (https://itunes.apple.com/br/app/cbb-connect/id860049561?l=en&mt=8)

CBB Connect (Web/Angular):
- CBB Connect iOS port to Web, using Angular and Angular Material

experiences.title: Fullstack Developer

At Tegra, I delivered 10+ projects for different market segments (including medical, retail, events, insurance, and banking); There, I was able to get a solid background on the entire Software Development cycle, from analysis & prototyping, through front end & back end, to delivery & distribution.

In this experience, I had contact with a wide range of technologies, and projects were mixed between green-field & years-old legacy projects/codebases.

Other contributions:

- Created & led their open technical meetup for the local community & college students
- Contributed to Tegra OSS projects (in their github org)

profile.headline: VP of Sales @ Chameleon, the deepest product adoption platform
profile.summary:
About Chameleon: 

Our mission is to drive a transformation in software — enabling product & growth teams to create dynamic, adaptive, personalized user experiences without a dependency on engineering.  

Chameleon makes it easy and delightful for your users to get to their aha moments, so that you can improve the metrics that drive your business forward. 

Learn more -> https://www.chameleon.io/interactive-demo


About Me: 

10+ years in sales leadership and advisory at early, growth, IPO+ stage SaaS companies. Love the art & science of sales and managing teams. 

*sales coaching, sales process, sales training & enablement, recruiting/hiring & onboarding, GTM strategy, territory planning, operating plan development, capacity planning, pipeline development & management, sales-manager coaching & development, executive/ board forecasting, pricing & packaging, cross-functional alignment, verticalizing, PLG, new business & expansion, inbound/outbound, mid-market & enterprise*

experiences.title: VP of Sales
experiences.description: The deepest product adoption platform~ In a world where user adoption drives revenue, Chameleon gives SaaS teams the most control, configuration, and customization to win with in-product UX.

experiences.title: Senior Director of Sales
experiences.description: Drift is the Conversational Marketing platform that brings your go-to-market teams together to deliver personalized customer experiences in real time – so you can increase your revenue, shorten your sales cycles, and strengthen your brand.⚡️

recommendations:
Emily Pick



I'm excited to endorse Charlotte Clutson, an extraordinary performance marketer who brings a winning spirit to any project she tackles. Charlotte's enthusiasm is contagious, and her readiness to dive into new challenges is inspiring. Yet, her determination doesn't come at the expense of strategic thinking. She's not afraid to respectfully challenge ideas that don't align with the objectives at hand, showcasing her commitment to quality and performance.

My collaboration with Charlotte on the competitor landing pages at Clearbit was an absolute delight. She brought a keen eye for detail and a relentless drive for optimization to the table, always seeking ways to improve and put us in a prime position to succeed. From my experience working with her, I can confidently say that Charlotte is a valuable asset to any team and would undoubtedly contribute significantly to any project. Her balance of initiative, professional courage, and commitment to goal-oriented strategies makes her an outstanding choice for any role in performance marketing.

Etienne Manière



Charlotte is one of the best I’ve worked with. From paid campaigns to email marketing, from project management to analytics, she is able to manage complex digital marketing challenges thanks to her broad range of skills, her pro-activity, her team player and hands-on mentality. It would be a pleasure to work with Charlotte again in the future.

profile.headline: Strategic Account Executive @ Chameleon, the deepest product adoption platform
profile.summary:
Software sales professional based in the San Francisco Bay Area focused on helping Product and CS teams build contextual, in-product experiences that get users to self-serve success without code or dev resources.

I also have a black lab (Willie), am an avid SF Giants, 49ers, Warriors fan, am an opinionated local burrito buff, and a proud average weekend golfer.

Specialties: Sales, Demand Generation, Conversational Marketing, Leadership, Competitive Analysis, Business Development.

experiences.title: Strategic MM Account Executive
experiences.description:

Learn more: chameleon.io

Connecting your sales teams with your future customers now.

recommendations:
Todd K.



Danny was a key member of my marketing team, with a diverse set of valuable skills. He is a talented marketer, who quickly grasps new technology concepts and is able to rapidly turn technical objectives into customer focused value propositions and messages. 

Danny successfully worked up and down the organization to progress our business goals, and is equally successful selling ideas and debating with leadership, as he is working day to day marketing tactics with marketing, agencies, sales and engineering teams. He's a pragmatic and resourceful marketer who would be a tremendous asset to any organization.

Brent Rich



When you need an insightful thinker you look for Danny. He never fails to surprise me with his ability to take even the most technical information and turn it into something understandable.  I would recommend Danny for any organization looking for a talented marketer that speaks geek with no translator is needed.

profile.headline: Content Marketing @ Chameleon, the deepest product adoption platform 🦎
profile.summary:
✨ Giulia is a full-stack marketer specialised in GTM for technical products. 👩🏼‍💻

➜ Currently Content Manager for Chameleon.io, prev StudentFinance, Decipad, Goodwall, Account Director for Inditex and IE University at Socialmood. 

From product onboarding to blockchain, Giulia excels at making complex topics simple and digestible for non-technical audiences. In three of the world’s most spoken languages, Giulia is able to adapt your content so that it reaches the right person, in the right way, at the right time. Together you will build innovative content strategies that inspire but also convert. 

Ready to cut through the noise?

experiences.title: Content Marketing Manager
experiences.description: Watch this space 😉

experiences.title: Product Marketing
experiences.description:
Spearheading Marketing for StudentFinance’s second product, Mydra (http://www.mydra.io). A cutting-edge platform designed for corporate learning that integrates skill mapping and flexible budget solutions within your very own bespoke course catalog.

Managing the strategic positioning and marketing of our product lineup involving market research, customer segmentation, and competitive analysis to better understand our target audiences and inform our product development and marketing strategies. I work closely with cross-functional teams, from Product to Partnerships, to ensure that our product messages resonate with our audiences and drive user acquisition, retention, and overall business growth.

experiences.title: Product Marketing Manager
experiences.description: Conducted user research to develop messaging and drive product adoption, resulting in an early access list growth of 150% in a year. Produced all marketing materials from webinars to product demos and technical blog articles. Collaborated with XFN teams from design to development to ensure product growth.

experiences.title: Product Marketing Manager
experiences.description: Responsible for executing go-to-market strategies and coordination for new feature launches, while offering support to the Head Marketing in creating, developing brand partnerships, and developing messaging strategies aimed at acquiring new users.

experiences.title: Digital Account Manager - Inditex and IE University
experiences.description: Developed a cohesive social media strategy for the organic and paid media campaigns of IE University resulting in a 50K following increase throughout all platforms in less than a month. Led the rebranding of Inditex Careers after an extensive audience analysis resulting in obtaining a 35% increase in job applications within in 3 months.

experiences.title: Social Media & Content Manager
experiences.description: Managed all of IE University’s social media channels. Implemented the digital integration of channels by executing inbound online marketing strategies across online platforms while monitoring, analyzing & optimizing social campaigns. Created a dissemination strategy for the ‘Driving Innovation’ campaign resulting in a 40% increase in converted leads over 2 months.

accomplishment_publications.name: Leadership Skills and Stories
accomplishment_publications.description: A case study chapter on María Eizaguirre’s leadership style.

volunteer_work.title: Consulting Team Leader
volunteer_work.description: 180 Degrees Consulting is the world's largest consultancy for non-profits and social enterprises, with operations in 35 countries and more than 5000 consultants worldwide. We aim to improve education, reduce homelessness, and alleviate poverty by helping non-profits and social enterprises to receive the support and expertise they need to improve and expand their services. To date, we have provided over 2.6 million hours of volunteer consulting services. At the same time, we develop the next generation of social impact leaders and social entrepreneurs.

volunteer_work.title: President & Public Relations Officer
volunteer_work.description:
As President of the IEU Student Government, my duties include:

- Leading and managing a team of 8 students towards our goals
- Organising events with budgets over 100,000 EUR, and up to 1000 guests
- Managing our annual budget of over 50,000 EUR
- Overseeing the Academic, Extra-curricular and Community Development student teams and managing over 20 people in both campuses.
- Various proposals to the University Administration on different areas of University Life

Managing the Social Media and external communication for the IE Student Government.
Responsibilities Include:
- Keeping the student body informed through Facebook, Instagram and regular email newsletters.
- Reinventing the communication channels and keeping the student body engaged.
- Designing posters and other forms of communication for university events.
- Being a point of contact in order to transfer information both from the students to the government and vice versa.

recommendations:
Kelly McEttrick



It’s rare to find someone like Giulia. She joined Decipad as our first GTM hire and made an immediate impact on the team and product. She’s smart, strategic, and a versatile operator who can deliver on a wide range of projects. Giulia wore many hats at Decipad, building our marketing strategy, running events, managing team operations, and nurturing early customer relationships. What sets Giulia apart is her curiosity and eagerness to tackle new challenges. She is someone you can count on to consistently deliver high-quality results and valuable insights. She excels at understanding and connecting with customers, using their feedback to shape the product and craft stories that resonate. I enjoy her open, prompt communication and entrepreneurial spirit that make her a dynamic asset to any team.

Amer Bhatti



Giulia is an incredibly tenacious person with multi-faceted skills; a truly well-rounded individual, she works incredibly well autonomously and is very innovative. A person who can excel at almost anything she tries her hand at.
